text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to explain that the Hague Convention on Choice of Court Agreements 2005 is the primary post-Brexit treaty mechanism for enforcing the UK judgment against the Irish competitor. The candidate answer mentions enforcement in Step 5, stating: \"EU Trademark Judgments: Enforceable under EU Regulation 1215/2012 (if you have an EU trademark). UK Judgments in Ireland: You may need to register the judgment in Ireland under the Reciprocal Enforcement of Judgments Act 1934.\" It fails to mention the Hague Convention on Choice of Court Agreements 2005 as the primary mechanism for enforcing UK judgments in Ireland post-Brexit, which is the specific requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "6f4d56bf-7905-4615-9fd4-579d9e5e0867"}
